channel.title: Israel National Radio - Aliyah Revolution
channel.description: The Aliyah Revolution is your home for practical advice and personal inspiration to ensure the success of your move to the Jewish State. Go'el Jasper and Daniel Esses interview professionals from aliyah organizations as well as profile new immigrants just like you to help make your aliyah dream a reality. Topics include what community to live in, how to find a job, and various struggles and triumphs that make up the English speaking immigrant experience. Plus your calls, emails and instant messages featured live on the air. The Aliyah Revolution podcast airs live every Monday from 6:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. Israel time on Israel National Radio. Check it out on Twitter at http://twitter.com/#!/aliyarevolution

image.title: Israel National Radio - Aliyah Revolution
image.description: A neo-Zionist perspective on Israel and the Jewish World.

item.title: 10 Keys to Aliyah. And Go'el and Daniel Say Goodbye
item.description:
Aliyah Revolution

Go'el and Daniel say goodbye, and provide listeners with the 10 keys for making Aliyah a reality for them.
item.itunes:subtitle: Go'el and Daniel say goodbye, and provide listeners with the 10 keys for making Aliyah a reality for them.

item.title: Say It Ain't So - Sad News from Go'el and Daniel
item.description:
Aliyah Revolution

Go'el and Daniel give the sad news that they will be signing off in just two more shows. But they also give valuable info about Aliyah.
item.itunes:subtitle: Go'el and Daniel give the sad news that they will be signing off in just two more shows. But they also give valuable info about Aliyah.

item.title: Learn How To Not Be A Fryer
item.description:
Aliyah Revolution

Take advice from everyone when making aliyah.
item.itunes:subtitle: Take advice from everyone when making aliyah.

item.title: Do Diaspora Jews Have a Say In Israel's Affairs?
item.description: Aliyah Revolution Diaspora Jews. How much of a say they should have in how Israel develops as the Jewish homeland?
item.itunes:subtitle: Diaspora Jews. How much of a say they should have in how Israel develops as the Jewish homeland?

item.title: Sweeping It Under the Rug
item.description:
Aliyah Revolution

 The "ill-advised" Israeli ad campaign promoting a return of Israelis to Israel from North America.
item.itunes:subtitle: The "ill-advised" Israeli ad campaign promoting a return of Israelis to Israel from North America.

item.title: Aliyah Billboards and Handymen
item.description:
Aliyah Revolution

 The Absorption Ministry's new ad campaign for those who left Israel. Plus, the secrets of handymen in Israel.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Absorption Ministry's new ad campaign for those who left Israel. Plus, the secrets of handymen in Israel.

item.title: G-d to Avraham: Go To The Place I will Show You
item.description:
Aliyah Revolution

What did God mean when directing Avraham to go to "the place I will show you?"
item.itunes:subtitle: What did God mean when directing Avraham to go to "the place I will show you?"

item.title: The Lessons of Moshe and Noach
item.description:
Aliyah Revolution

Go'el talks about how important it is to appreciate Jewish history, and what our destiny is. And Daniel gives Go'el a pop quiz.
item.itunes:subtitle: Go'el talks about how important it is to appreciate Jewish history, and what our destiny is. And Daniel gives Go'el a pop quiz.

item.title: Always Tell 'em To Come Home
item.description:
Aliyah Revolution

Maurice Singer discusses his Aliyah advisory service. Goel and Daniel disagree with telling someone Aliyah might not work for them.
item.itunes:subtitle: Maurice Singer discusses his Aliyah advisory service. Goel and Daniel disagree with telling someone Aliyah might not work for them.

item.title: An Oleh In Israeli Politics
item.description:
Aliyah Revolution

Rabbi Dov Lipman talks about the impact he and other American Olim are making in a challenging political issue in Beit Shemesh.
item.itunes:subtitle: Rabbi Dov Lipman talks about the impact he and other American Olim are making in a challenging political issue in Beit Shemesh.
